p: Ethyl 2-(4-((isopropylamino)methyl)phenyl)-1-(4-methylbenzyl)cyclopropane-1-carboxylate (9). Isopropylamine (26 µL, 0.292 mmol) was added dropwise to compound 7 (50 mg, 0.15 mmol) in neat at 0 °C, and the mixture was allowed to stir at room temperature for 24 h. The reaction was quenched with the addition of 4 M NaOH aq. solution, extracted with dichloromethane (3 × 5 ml), and the combined organic layers were separated, washed with brine, dried over anhydrous Na 2SO 4, and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue obtained was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel using methanol/dichloromethane (2:98) to obtain the title compound as a colourless oil in 60% yield. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl 3) δ 7.31 (t, J = 7.9 Hz, 2H), 7.22 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.05 (s, 4H), 4.27 − 4.06 (m, 2H), 3.81 (s, 2H), 3.19 (d, J = 15.6 Hz, 1H), 2.87 (ddd, J = 16.3, 13.4, 7.1 Hz, 2H), 2.31 (s, 3H), 1.93 − 1.79 (m, 2H), 1.40 (dd, J = 7.2, 5.0 Hz, 1H), 1.22 (t, J = 7.1 Hz, 3H), 1.14 (d, J = 6.3 Hz, 6H).
